query: I have a headache. Can I take Ibuprofen?
report: Yes, Ibuprofen is an effective OTC option for tension headaches in adults.

query: My name is Carlos, 33. I have mild heartburn. Can I take Tums?
report: Yes, Tums (Calcium Carbonate) is appropriate for occasional mild heartburn.

query: I'm Lily, 28. I have seasonal allergies. Is Cetirizine okay daily?
report: Yes, Cetirizine is safe for daily use during allergy season.

query: I'm Ahmed, 50. I have fungal nail. Can I use Terbinafine cream?

query: I'm Grace, 19. I have bad menstrual cramps. Is Naproxen okay?
report: Yes, Naproxen is excellent for menstrual cramps as it reduces prostaglandins.

query: I'm Tony, 45. I have back pain. Can I take Aspirin?
report: Yes, Aspirin can help with mild back pain, but NSAIDs like Ibuprofen may be more effective.

query: My name is Nancy, 60. I have arthritis pain. Is Acetaminophen safe?
report: Yes, Acetaminophen is first-line for osteoarthritis pain and is generally safe at recommended doses.

query: I'm Diego, 25. I have poison ivy rash. Can I use Hydrocortisone cream?
report: Yes, OTC Hydrocortisone cream can help relieve itching from poison ivy.

query: My name is Olivia, 35. I have canker sore. Is Orajel safe to use?

query: I'm Henry, 42. I have mild constipation. Is Docusate sodium okay?
report: Yes, Docusate is a gentle stool softener appropriate for occasional constipation.

query: My name is Zoe, 29. I have travel nausea. Can I take Dramamine?
report: Yes, Dimenhydrinate (Dramamine) is effective for motion sickness prevention.

query: I'm Victor, 55. I have hemorrhoids. Is Preparation H okay?

query: My name is Isabella, 31. I have cold sores. Is Abreva effective?
report: Yes, Docosanol (Abreva) can reduce healing time if applied at first sign of outbreak.

query: I'm Nathan, 48. I have athlete's foot. Can I use Lotrimin?
report: Yes, Clotrimazole (Lotrimin) is an effective OTC antifungal for athlete's foot.

query: My name is Chloe, 26. I have dandruff. Is Head & Shoulders okay?

query: I'm Julian, 39. I have acid reflux. Is Pepcid AC safe?

query: My name is Maya, 44. I have dry eyes. Are artificial tears safe?

query: I'm Aaron, 57. I have bronchitis cough. Is Robitussin DM okay?
report: Yes, Dextromethorphan (Robitussin DM) can help suppress bronchitis cough.

query: My name is Luna, 23. I have sunburn. Can I use Aloe Vera gel?

query: I'm Elias, 52. I have nasal congestion. Is Afrin safe?

query: My name is Penelope, 36. I have vaginal itching. Is Monistat okay?

query: I'm Max, 41. I have muscle strain. Is Bengay safe to use?

query: My name is Stella, 58. I have cold symptoms. Is DayQuil safe?

query: I'm Leo, 33. I have diarrhea. Can I take Imodium?

query: My name is Hazel, 47. I have allergies. Is Benadryl safe?
report: Yes, but Diphenhydramine causes drowsiness - avoid when driving or operating machinery.

query: I'm Owen, 29. I have warts. Is Compound W effective?
report: Yes, Salicylic acid (Compound W) is effective for common warts with consistent use.

query: My name is Eleanor, 63. I have arthritis. Is Voltaren gel safe?

query: I'm Gabriel, 37. I have gas pain. Is Gas-X safe?
report: Yes, Simethicone (Gas-X) is safe and effective for gas relief.

query: My name is Nora, 51. I have UTI symptoms. Is Azo safe?

query: I'm Wyatt, 45. I have jock itch. Can I use Lotrimin?
report: Yes, Clotrimazole (Lotrimin) is effective for jock itch fungal infections.

query: My name is Aurora, 32. I have chapped lips. Is Carmex safe?

query: I'm Caleb, 54. I have heartburn. Is Mylanta safe?

query: My name is Scarlett, 40. I have cold. Is Mucinex safe?
report: Yes, Guaifenesin (Mucinex) is safe for chest congestion.

query: I'm Ezra, 35. I have poison oak. Is calamine lotion safe?
report: Yes, calamine lotion is safe and effective for poison oak itching relief.

query: My name is Naomi, 59. I have dry skin. Is Eucerin safe?

query: I'm Asher, 43. I have sore throat. Are Chloraseptic sprays safe?

query: My name is Elena, 38. I have PMS bloating. Is Midol safe?

query: I'm Adam, 56. I have nasal dryness. Is saline spray safe?

query: My name is Clara, 34. I have razor burn. Is hydrocortisone safe?

query: I'm Julian, 49. I have mouth ulcer. Is Gly-Oxide safe?

query: My name is Rose, 61. I have eczema. Is Cortizone-10 safe?

query: I'm Tristan, 39. I have ringworm. Is Lotrimin Ultra safe?

query: My name is Iris, 46. I have hot flashes. Is Remifemin safe?

query: I'm Blake, 53. I have bronchitis. Is Robitussin PE safe?

query: My name is Lila, 30. I have UTI pain. Is Uristat safe?

query: I'm Cole, 42. I have contact dermatitis. Is Cortaid safe?

query: My name is Maya, 55. I have acid reflux. Is Gaviscon safe?

query: I'm Evan, 36. I have cold sores. Is Herpecin-L safe?

query: My name is Leah, 48. I have vaginal dryness. Is Replens safe?

query: I'm Miles, 57. I have BPH. Is saw palmetto effective?

query: My name is Ruby, 33. I have UTI. Is Cystex effective?

query: I'm Eric, 44. I have high cholesterol. My Lipitor is too expensive. Cheaper option?

query: I'm Michael, 52. My Advair inhaler is expensive. Cheaper version?

query: My name is Olivia, 38. My Sumatriptan for migraines is costly. Options?

query: My name is Emma, 45. My Synthroid is brand-only expensive. Generic?

query: I'm John, 65. My Rayos for PMR is costly. Alternative?

query: My name is Madison, 47. My Juvederm fillers are expensive. Cheaper?

query: I'm Anthony, 60. My Xiidra for dry eye is costly. Options?
report: Generic cyclosporine (Restasis) or OTC artificial tears are lower-cost alternatives.

query: My name is Addison, 38. My Orilissa for endometriosis is expensive. Help?
report: Progestin-only pills or conventional GnRH agonists may be more affordable options.

query: I'm Christopher, 55. My Tudorza inhaler for COPD is costly. Cheaper?

report: Generic Beclomethasone or other corticosteroid inhalers may have lower copays.

query: I'm Andrew, 63. My Savella for fibromyalgia is costly. Alternative?
report: Generic Duloxetine or Gabapentin are lower-cost options for fibromyalgia pain.

query: My name is Audrey, 51. My Linzess for constipation is expensive. Cheaper?

query: I'm Joshua, 57. My Bystolic for blood pressure is costly. Options?
report: Generic Metoprolol or Atenolol are much less expensive beta-blocker alternatives.

query: My name is Hannah, 42. My Uptravi for PAH is unaffordable. Help?
report: Contact manufacturer patient assistance programs as PAH medications have few low-cost options.

query: I'm Jonathan, 59. My Teflaro for infection is expensive. Alternative?

query: My name is Allison, 48. My Fetzima for depression is costly. Options?
report: Generic SSRIs like Sertraline or Escitalopram are first-line and very inexpensive.

query: I'm Christian, 54. My Adempas for PAH is expensive. Cheaper?

query: I'm Dylan, 62. My Ofev for PF is expensive. Alternative?

query: I was prescribed Prednisone but worried about weight gain. Normal?
report: Weight gain and fluid retention are common side effects of corticosteroids like Prednisone, usually temporary with short-term use.

query: My name is Robert, 58. My doctor wants me on Statin but I fear muscle pain.
report: Muscle pain is a known side effect. Your doctor can start low and switch to better-tolerated statins like Pravastatin if needed.

query: I'm Anna, 70. I need antidepressant but worried about nausea side effects.
report: SSRIs can cause initial nausea that often subsides. Taking with food and starting low can minimize this.

query: My name is Omar, 45. Metformin for diabetes causes stomach issues. Normal?
report: GI upset is very common when starting Metformin. Taking with meals or extended-release formulation can help.

query: I'm Sarah, 33. Prescribed Accutane for acne but worried about dryness.
report: Severe dryness is expected with Isotretinoin. Intensive moisturizing and lip balm are essential during treatment.

query: My name is Thomas, 52. My blood pressure med Lisinopril causes cough. Normal?
report: Dry cough is a common side effect of ACE inhibitors like Lisinopril. Your doctor can switch you to an ARB like Losartan.

query: I'm Jennifer, 41. My antidepressant Wellbutrin makes me jittery. Concern?
report: Agitation and insomnia are known side effects of Bupropion. Taking it earlier in the day or dose adjustment may help.

query: My name is Kevin, 63. My diabetes drug Jardiance causes UTIs. Risk?
report: SGLT2 inhibitors like Empagliflozin do increase UTI risk. Good hygiene and hydration are important preventive measures.

query: I'm Lisa, 29. My birth control Yaz causes mood swings. Normal?
report: Mood changes can occur with hormonal contraceptives. A different progestin formulation may be better tolerated.

query: My name is Michael, 57. My prostate drug Flomax causes dizziness. Concern?
report: Dizziness and orthostatic hypotension are common with alpha-blockers like Tamsulosin. Rise slowly from sitting position.

query: I'm Maria, 48. My osteoporosis drug Fosamax causes heartburn. Normal?
report: GI irritation is common with oral bisphosphonates. Take with full glass of water and remain upright for 30 minutes.

query: My name is David, 55. My gout drug Allopurinol causes rash. Dangerous?
report: Rash requires immediate medical attention as it could indicate serious hypersensitivity reaction.

query: I'm Susan, 37. My acne antibiotic Doxycycline causes sun sensitivity. Risk?
report: Photosensitivity is expected with tetracyclines. Use broad-spectrum sunscreen and sun protection during treatment.

query: My name is James, 60. My Parkinson's drug Levodopa causes dyskinesia. Normal?
report: Involuntary movements are a common long-term side effect. Dose adjustments or additional medications can help manage this.

query: I'm Patricia, 42. My migraine prevention Topamax causes tingling. Concern?
report: Paresthesia (tingling) is a very common side effect of Topiramate, usually harmless but should be monitored.

query: My name is Richard, 58. My blood thinner Eliquis causes easy bruising. Normal?
report: Increased bruising is expected with anticoagulants. Watch for excessive bleeding or large bruises.

query: I'm Barbara, 51. My arthritis drug Methotrexate causes fatigue. Normal?
report: Fatigue is common after Methotrexate dose. Taking it at bedtime and using folic acid can help reduce side effects.

query: My name is Charles, 64. My glaucoma drops cause red eyes. Concern?
report: Some prostaglandin analogs can cause conjunctival redness. This is usually cosmetic but mention to your ophthalmologist.

query: I'm Jessica, 35. My anxiety drug Xanax causes memory issues. Risk?
report: Cognitive impairment and memory problems are known side effects of benzodiazepines, especially with long-term use.

query: My name is Matthew, 53. My diabetes drug Invokana causes yeast infections. Normal?
report: Genital yeast infections are common with SGLT2 inhibitors due to glucose excretion in urine.

query: I'm Nancy, 46. My thyroid drug Synthroid causes hair loss. Temporary?
report: Hair loss can occur when starting or adjusting Levothyroxine, usually temporary as body adjusts to new hormone levels.

query: My name is Donald, 59. My BPH drug Proscar affects sexual function. Common?
report: Decreased libido and erectile dysfunction are potential side effects of 5-alpha reductase inhibitors like Finasteride.

query: I'm Sandra, 44. My antidepressant Lexapro causes weight gain. Likely?
report: Weight gain is a possible side effect of many SSRIs including Escitalopram, though individual response varies.

query: My name is Paul, 61. My cholesterol drug Zetia causes joint pain. Common?
report: Musculoskeletal pain is a reported side effect of Ezetimibe, though less common than with statins.

query: I'm Karen, 39. My birth control IUD causes irregular bleeding. Normal?
report: Irregular spotting is common during first 3-6 months with hormonal IUDs, usually improves over time.

query: My name is Mark, 56. My blood pressure drug Norvasc causes ankle swelling.
report: Peripheral edema is a common side effect of calcium channel blockers like Amlodipine. Dose reduction or diuretic may help.

query: I'm Betty, 50. My osteoporosis drug Prolia causes jaw pain. Serious?
report: Jaw pain or osteonecrosis requires immediate dental evaluation as it's a rare but serious side effect of denosumab.

query: My name is Jason, 47. My antidepressant Cymbalta causes sweating. Normal?
report: Excessive sweating is a known side effect of SNRIs like Duloxetine. Dose adjustment or medication change may help.

query: I'm Helen, 43. My migraine drug Imitrex causes chest tightness. Dangerous?
report: Chest symptoms with triptans require evaluation to rule out cardiac causes, though often non-cardiac.

query: My name is Ronald, 62. My prostate drug Avodart affects PSA tests. Concern?
report: 5-alpha reductase inhibitors like Dutasteride lower PSA levels by about 50%, which must be considered in cancer screening.

query: I'm Deborah, 38. My acne drug Spironolactone causes frequent urination. Normal?
report: Spironolactone is a diuretic, so increased urination is expected. Take earlier in day to avoid nighttime disruption.

query: My name is Steven, 55. My gout drug Colchicine causes diarrhea. Management?
report: GI upset is common with Colchicine. Taking with food or dose reduction can help. Severe diarrhea requires medical attention.

query: I'm Sharon, 49. My RA drug Humira causes injection site reactions. Normal?
report: Injection site reactions are common with biologics. Rotate sites and use ice before injection to minimize.

query: My name is Edward, 60. My Parkinson's drug Mirapex causes sleep attacks. Risk?
report: Sudden sleep episodes are a serious side effect of dopamine agonists. Avoid driving until response is known.

query: I'm Donna, 45. My antidepressant Effexor causes withdrawal. How to avoid?
report: Venlafaxine has significant discontinuation syndrome. Always taper slowly under medical supervision.

query: My name is George, 58. My blood thinner Plavix causes itching. Allergic?
report: Rash or itching may indicate hypersensitivity. Contact your doctor as alternative antiplatelet options exist.

query: I'm Carol, 52. My osteoporosis drug Reclast causes flu-like symptoms. Normal?
report: Acute phase reaction with fever and body aches is common after first zoledronic acid infusion, usually resolves in days.

query: My name is Brian, 47. My ADHD drug Adderall causes appetite loss. Concern?
report: Decreased appetite is expected with stimulants. Take with food and monitor weight, especially in children.

query: I'm Margaret, 41. My birth control patch causes skin irritation. Normal?
report: Skin reactions under the patch are common. Rotate application sites and avoid same area for several weeks.

query: My 2-year-old has fever. Can I give her a small piece of adult Tylenol?
report: No, this is extremely dangerous. Use only infant acetaminophen and measure dose precisely by weight with provided syringe.

query: My 10-year-old son has pink eye. Can I use leftover antibiotic drops?
report: No, never use old medication. Pink eye can be viral or bacterial requiring proper diagnosis and fresh prescription.

query: My 6-year-old daughter has cough. Is children's Robitussin DM safe?
